H0.text: who designed the first toy released by nintendo. Masayuki Uemura

H1.text: who designed the first toy released by nintendo. Hiroshi Yamauchi

H2.text: who designed the first toy released by nintendo. Shigeru Miyamoto

H3.text: who designed the first toy released by nintendo. Gunpei Yokoi

A4.text: In 1966, Hiroshi Yamauchi took notice of a toy made by Gunpei Yokoi during his spare time and ordered him to develop it as a proper product for the Christmas rush. The Ultra Hand was a huge success and became a flagship product for Nintendo.

A5.text: Gunpei Yokoi, Nintendo's main toy designer at the time, discussed with him the possibility of using Sharp's solar cells on interesting products, using their light-detecting capabilities for a shooting game.
